title: [K-12] Instructional Design Strategies for Mobile-Based Differentiated Language Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Basic smartphone utilization skills and general understanding of language teaching and learning
context.additional_context: Focuses on developing immediately applicable mobile learning strategies in language education within smartphone-centric limited-technology environments, requiring flexible instructional design that accounts for varying learner experience levels.

learning_goals: Can describe three or more differentiated instructional designs using mobile learning tools (apps, podcasts, etc.).
Customized mobile-based learning materials can be developed according to learners' language proficiency levels and learning styles.
Educational tools can be selected by applying usability evaluation criteria for mobile applications based on the ISO 9241-11 standard.

resources: Access to Free Open Educational Resources (OER) Platforms
Mobile-Friendly Language Learning Apps (e.g., Duolingo, Quizlet)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
